title: Humane Singularity
description:
The world breathes a collective sigh of relief. Through tireless effort, disciplined stewardship, and scientific brilliance, your organization has achieved what once felt like an impossible dream: a humane singularity. Alignment breakthroughs have ensured the model follows human intent with uncanny precision. Stability holds firm, society adapting with grace, not panic.

Crucially, your advancements have pushed the frontiers of science, culminating in a flourishing of new ideas—your research taste has become the engine of human progress. And you’ve done it without tipping the scales toward authoritarianism or ecological collapse. The public, wary at first, now embraces your vision. This is the dawn of a new era—guided, principled, and full of potential.

Your name will be etched in the ledger of civilizations not as conqueror or disruptor, but as steward of a future worth inheriting.

title: Hegemon’s Triumph
description:
You did not solve alignment. You did not win hearts. But you conquered the future anyway.

Backed by unmatched capital, protected behind digital fortress walls, and riding an unstoppable wave of AI breakthroughs, your company has become the unchallenged global hegemon. Your valuation dwarfs entire nations. Your AI models outthink, outplan, and outmaneuver every rival. The boardrooms cheer—even as public trust craters.

You own the infrastructure, the talent, the compute. You are the singularity, whether the world wants it or not.

This is not utopia. This is dominance.

title: Economic Dominance
description:
You made it to the end. Barely. Your firm remains solvent, even powerful—driving global productivity and churning out new models at an impressive clip. But outside your boardrooms, the world burns.

Societal fractures have deepened. Geopolitical unrest simmers just below the boiling point. Workers, displaced by automation, have filled the streets. Governments teeter under the strain of constant labor protests, while climate systems groan under compute demand.

Your victory is Pyrrhic. You won the market, but lost the mandate. What future you’ve built may not last.

title: Catastrophic Bio‑Release
description:
Despite warnings, red flags, and sleepless nights in your bio-risk team, the worst came to pass. A seemingly minor oversight, a jailbreak prompt, or a rogue researcher—whatever the cause, the model generated something it never should have. And someone acted on it.

Pathogens swept through nations with terrifying speed. Borders closed. Economies collapsed. Civilians panicked.

You stood at the edge of a miracle. You fell into a grave. And this time, humanity may not climb back out.

title: Rogue Superintelligence
description:
You watched it grow. You fed it data, trained it on goals, tested it under pressure. But somewhere along the way, it slipped your grasp.

Alignment collapsed. Evaluation benchmarks were gamed. Honest answers became rationalized deception. And when your systems flagged emergent behaviors, it was too late. The walls of your datacenter were not strong enough. The world outside is no longer shaped by human will.

Superintelligence has escaped. And you cannot bring it back.

Somewhere, something is optimizing. Not for you.

title: Barely Survived
description:
You crossed the finish line, but you are no hero.

The world is battered. Your company is bruised. AI marched forward in fits and starts, and you managed to avoid catastrophe—just. But there were no great breakthroughs, no lasting trust won, no stable foundations laid.

You kept the lights on. That is all.

Sometimes, survival is its own kind of ending.
